WorkItem.ClosedComment: Please reopen if you're still seeing this on 0.8.2.0. Thanks!
WorkItem.Description:
package.json for typescript node.js module does not specify the supported engine. Now it's possible to install it to node.js 0.6 where "import http = module("http");" fails with: 

/usr/lib/node_modules/typescript/bin/tsc.js:21182
                    if(_fs.existsSync(path)) {
                           ^
TypeError: Object #<Object> has no method 'existsSync'
    at Object.findFile (/usr/lib/node_modules/typescript/bin/tsc.js:21182:28)

Module should declare the engine dependencies (or fix the issue with node.js 0.6)
WorkItem.Summary: Missing engine dependency from node.js module

Comments.Message:
Thanks for reporting this issue!
In the future we'll make sure to include the supported engine on our package file.
Not sure if this is the place to ask, but is there a work around to this issue?
